job_title: Lead Financial Analyst in Meadville, PA
pros: Great benefits, opportunity for advancement
cons: Covid vaccines mandatory for employment unless religious exemption

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Meadville, PA
pros: Small community hospital & a lot of great services.
cons: Small town mindset. People who are horrible workers get put in leadership positions and it all depends on who you know. No opportunity to improve

review_title: Better than most, still room for improvement
pros: Great place to work if you have the right the supervisor. Salary positions are flexible if you have appointments etc. Upper management does engage in appreciation and tries to listen to the employees. There are annual reviews and cost of living adjustments.
cons: Work load is not consistent from position to position. Some positions have very little work while others consistently work overtime to complete expected tasks. There are definitely some favorites that can do no wrong.

pros: Small hometown hospital with some advanced technology
cons: Horrible turnover and poor work ethic

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Meadville, PA
pros: Somewhat good benefits, paid sick time, decent insurance.
cons: Lack incentives for current employees but willing to do more for new ones.

pros: Good community, good work schedule
cons: The pay should be more

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Meadville, PA
pros: Good benefits, nice co-workers, pay so-so
cons: Short staffed often. Pay could be better, much lower than local nursing homes are offering.

job_title: Licensed Professional Counselor in Meadville, PA
pros: It is a well-paying salaried position for the area
cons: This company is very heavy at the top and acts very much as a "good ol' boys club." They all know each other, hang out and make sure they're taken care of. If you're not "in," you're not gonna heard.

pros: Flexible schedule and three 12 hour shifts
cons: You will float a lot.

pros: Small community hospital. Fair amount of specialists available.
cons: Inadequate physician coverage. Long hours that are uncompensated. Unsafe physician to patient ratio. Inadequate nursing coverage.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Meadville, PA
pros:
Competitive pay, Benefit time,
Learning experiences
cons:
Outdated environment
Inappropriate patients placed randomly on units just to fill beds
Consistent staffing shortage

review_title: Not a good place to work, I couldn't give 1/2 star
pros: Competitive compensation, benefits, and vacation time
cons:
-Dingy, tired looking hospital; in need of a massive overhaul; not only in appearance but an overhaul of dead wood management (most who have been there 30+ years). Time to step into the 20th century.
-All employees look like they would rather be somewhere else, no one smiles, everyone looks dour and stressed.
-Zero support from management, culture of blame, support staff virtually non existent. Professional staff has to help the support staff. 
-The highly questionable practice of hiring support staff who have no experience working in a professional clinical department. 
-Back stabbing co workers, massive micromanagement, and needless over-complexity.
-Very difficult to work where one may work 3-4 different shifts during work week. Standardize work schedule into a 8-10 work schedule matrix. This is a reason why errors occur.

review_title: Love the job but management is out of touch
pros:
Love the position I'm currently in
Steady work
Close to home
cons:
Low pay for those who actually are face to face with patients 
A lot of "passing the buck" and no one willing to take responsibility for failures or mistakes 
A lot of behind-the-scenes outsourcing

pros: Co-workers are nice for the most part. Starting wages are competitive.
cons: Not enough staff in certain departments. Not enough choices for hours. Technology in certain departments is sub par.

review_title: It's been ok although I am not afforded the respect or responsibilities my degree affords me.
pros: It's steady employment and close to home.
cons: No clinical social work supervision available.

pros: Small community makes it easy to get to know the people you're working with. Also makes the job comfortable, as if you're amongst friends.
cons: Management doesn't seem to listen to complaints or do anything worthwhile to help make things work better or smoother.

pros: Fair wages and benefits and have given me a fairly flexible schedule.
cons: The 12 hour shifts are from 3 am to 3 pm/3pm to 3am.  This is a difficult schedule for those with a family with infants, small children and school age children.

review_title: Great place to work. Love work atmosphere.
pros: Benefits are great and they pay well. All staff are extremely friendly and helpful.
cons: There is a lot of overtime available.

pros: Good coworkers and in a good area
cons: Business process are way behind the times.  Poor upper management.
